Class Admin

java.lang.Object
User
Admin
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class Admin
extends User
Represents an admin that uses the MySTARS system application. An Admin is an user, therefore it inherits the User class.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Admin​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String username, MySTARS mainApp)
    Creates a new Admin with the given name, username and MySTARS class object.

  • Constructor Details

    • Admin

      public Admin​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String username, MySTARS mainApp)
      Creates a new Admin with the given name, username and MySTARS class object. The name should include both first and last name.
      Parameters:
      name - This Admin's full name.
      username - This Admin account's username.
      mainApp - This Admin's MySTARS class object.

  • Method Details

    • editPeriod

      public void editPeriod​(java.util.Date start, java.util.Date end)
      Method that allows Admin to update the registration period with the given start and end date.
      Parameters:
      start - New starting date of the registration period.
      end - New ending date of the registration period.

    • addStudent

      public void addStudent​(java.lang.String name, java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password, int maxAU, java.lang.String gender, java.lang.String nationality, java.lang.String matricNumber, java.lang.String email)
      Method that allows Admin to add and create an account for a Student with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      name - New Student's full name.
      username - New Student account's username.
      password - New Student account's password.
      maxAU - New Student's maximum number of AU.
      gender - New Student's gender.
      nationality - New Student's nationality.
      matricNumber - New Student's matriculation number.
      email - New Student's email account.

    • addCourse

      public void addCourse​(java.lang.String school, java.lang.String courseCode, java.lang.String courseName, int numOfAU)
      Method that allows Admin to add an new Course with the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      school - The school that provides the new Course. E.g. SCSE, MAE, etc.
      courseCode - The code of the new Course. E.g. CZ2001, CZ2002, etc.
      courseName - The name of the new Course. E.g. Algorithms
      numOfAU - The number of academic units of the new Course

    • updateCourse

      public void updateCourse​(Course course)
      Method that allows Admin to update an existing Course.
      Parameters:
      course - The exisiting Course object to be updated.

    • printByCourse

      public void printByCourse​(Course course)
      Method that allows Admin to print all the registered Students of an existing Course.
      Parameters:
      course - The existing Course object with the registered Students to be printed.

    • printByIndex

      public void printByIndex​(Index index)
      Method that allows Admin to print all the registered Students of an existing Index object of an existing Course.
      Parameters:
      index - The existing Index object with the registered Students to be printed.

    • printStudents

      public void printStudents()
      Method that allows Admin to print all the Students in the database after adding a new Student into the database.
